Text: ComplimentsThis is late feedback but wanted you to know that your presentation at the Directors Conference was well done The expansion opportunities are exciting and challenging and I felt you used the opportunity well to thank and recognize some Operations folks who make the system work Mike Nelson VP ETS Pipeline Integrity Program Management

Thanks Monday Staff Meeting Cc Rod I appreciated your method and style of communication this morning You spoke clearly with obvious knowledge and expertise and came across as straight None of us can take this for granted especially during times like this simply because we need to know what we need to know The trust credibility and integrity factors have been shaken at Enron and no spin on the facts will do Thanks Mike Nelson VP Pipeline Integrity Program Management

EOTTStan Phil forwarded to me your response see below to the e mail he had sent regarding the Robin Border memo I concur with your thoughts on trust and will continue my efforts in that regard Thanks for the update Doesnt appear as Robin is helping out any I am not sure why Dana values his opinions so much on this topic Keep working the progress The key people you need to make happy are Robert and Dan I trust that Mike is developing a effective relationship with them and Dana Trust is essential in making this partnership work Ive been meeting with a nunber of the ETS folks that have been working on EOTT issues and assignments and although we have been working hard we simply have some additional work to do in the areas of communication which I will address and facilitate We meet with the commercial folks on Tuesday after the normal EOTT Staff Meeting regarding the Enhanced Integrity Plan where we can hopefully move forward In addition I will put together a presentation outlining the EOTT Integrity Plan for presentation the next time the commercial folks meet It will also include facts of our ongoing remediation plan and hydrotest pigging efforts for In my opinion the EOTT operations assignment has been a challenge for ETS ETS and Phil in particular has dedicated tremendous effort to significantly enhance EOTT operations Few could have tackled the EOTT operational challenges as well as Phil has Besides the fact that it may not have been a popular decision at EOTT to relinquish control of Operations he has done an outstanding job in keeping his staff focused on performance with integrity and quality all the time within a financial framework that adds value to the overall picture of Enron and EOTT It has not been easy I am confident you recognize how well he has changed the face of operations in ETS and EOTT as you have changed the face of both organizations overall Best wishes for a good Thanksgiving Mike Nelson VP Pipeline Integrity Program Management

Per discussion article on Rebecca MarkFREE AND CLEAR OF ENRONS WOES Edited by Sheridan Prasso By Stephanie Anderson Forest BusinessWeek Page Copyright McGrawHill Inc Back in Enrons heyday one of its rising stars was Rebecca Mark Nicknamed Mark the Shark because of her ferocious ambition she made her name in the early s building the energy giants international operations including the nowtroubled Dabhol power plant in India Once rumored to be a successor to Enron CEO Ken Lay she resigned from Enron in August after two years of heading Enrons ailing water company spinoff Azurix These days as Enron struggles to stay afloat MarkJusbasche who hyphenated her name with that of her husband of two years is watching the action from the sidelines And shed like to keep it that way Im very surprised and saddened by what has happened at Enron and I wish them all the best she says Beyond that MarkJusbasche is not much interested in talking about Enron which is being acquired by a small rival after a spectacular Wall Street flameout Mark left Enron with millions of dollars worth of Enron shares although she says she has sold them since MarkJusbasche spends most of her time serving on advisory boards both at Yale and Harvard business schools as well as the school where her yearold twin sons from a previous marriage are sophomores In her spare time she seeks out opportunities for investing Currently MarkJusbasche is considering alternativeenergy and watertechnology companies A farm girl from Missouri she has one investment focus thats especially dear to her heart looking into expanding her cattle ranches She now owns acres in New Mexico Im doing things that are fun interesting and important to mefamily and community she says Sure beats being anywhere near Enron

John Millar Cc Danny I believe John Millar works for Eric Gadd in Business Development If my sources are correct John is a former EOTT employee We are looking to possibly use John if he available in a special and critical role regarding EOTT pipeline integrity This would likely be at least a six month and maybe a year long effort Give me a call Mike Nelson VP Pipeline Integrity Program Management

RE Late FeedbackI guess timing is everything or close to it Best wishes for the rest of the weekend Original Message From Corman Shelley Sent Saturday October PM To Nelson Mike Subject Re Late Feedback Thanks I needed that today Sent from my BlackBerry Wireless Handheld wwwBlackBerrynet

Late FeedbackShelley This has been on my to do list for a while but wanted you to know formally that I very much enjoyed and appreciated your presentation at the ETS Operations Directors Conference It is imperative Operations and Gas Logistics work together and stay aligned in critical objectives You continue to demonstrate why you are respected within the leadership ranks Thanks Mike Nelson VP ETS Pipeline Integrity Program Management
